page.title: 04NORTH CHERITON (wild life)
page.content: North Cheriton has only a hall and a church. It is in a conservation area and house-building is restricted. Lower Farm now almost derelict sold recently for Â£80,000 will sell now for Â£135,000.Land value has moved from Â£300 per acre in 1960 to Â£3000 in 1985 The area is abundant with flora and fauna.Around the wood known as Gale's Copse have been seen wild animals as follows:- hares rabbits moles hedgehogs foxes roe deer badgers squirrels weasels stoats shrew mice fieldmice voles brown rats adders slowworms newts crested newts frogs toads
